post: The Battle of Antietam remains the deadliest single day in U. S. history, 23,000 casualties that shifted the Civil Wars direction and opened the door to the Emancipation Proclamation. Our newest A250 Mini Documentary helps students explore why this moment was pivotal to defining Americas ideals of freedom and self-government. 🎥 Watch here:  https://bit.ly/4oRoivw  #A250  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory  #CivilWar  #TeachingResources

🎉 Honoring Educators Who Bring the Declaration to Life Were thrilled to announce the first 63 winners of the Civic Star Challenge, a nationwide initiative from the Bill of Rights Institute and iCivics that empowers K–12 teachers to celebrate Americas founding principles in the classroom. These educators, representing more than 25 states, are inspiring the next generation to see liberty, equality, and civic virtue not just as history, but as living ideals. Each winner receives $300 in recognition of their commitment to bringing the Declaration of Independence to life through adaptable, classroom-ready lessons. As BRI President David Bobb shared, The Civic Star Challenge honors the educators who keep Americas founding principles alive in their classrooms. Their work reminds us that civic knowledge and virtue are essential to sustaining liberty for the next generation.  Congratulations to this first round of winners, and thank you to every teacher who continues to make civic learning a daily act of service. 🌟 🔗 Read the full announcement:  https://bit.ly/3LvYuX0  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #America250  #Teachers  #CivicLearning  #EducationLeadership
